Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen, Iwant to share with

you what I like to call my garlic sesame stir
fried asparagus.

If you follow me on my vlog channel, you should
if you don't, a while back, I showed - Iwas

making an Asian inspired meal, I had my teriyaki
salmon, my stir fried rice, which you can

find both recipes on LauraintheKitchen.com
and along side, Imade this asparagus, and

it was to die for, and they have been my go
to asparagus recipe ever since, and Ihave

had so many people ask if I could share the
recipe here on Laura in the Kitchen, so Ifigured
why not?

They are incredibly easy and simple to make,
they just require a handful of ingredients,

like, of course, some fresh asparagus, I like
to cut them into about 2 inch pieces, I've
got some sesame seeds, white sesame seeds.

Lots of garlic, vegetable oil, soy sauce,
and some toasted sesame oil.

That is it, you're not going to need a lot
of ingredients, but they are just phenomenal
all together.

This is not a brand new idea by any means,
but it is good.

The first thing I want to do in my skillet
is, actually toast up my sesame seeds, by

toasting up my sesame seeds, it really brings
out their flavor, so I'm just going to toast

them in a dry skillet, and I don't need to
add any oil to this whatsoever.

You can actually buy toasted sesame seeds,
but they are incredibly expensive, and I'm
not doing that.

So I just like to buy regular old sesame seeds
that way I can toast them up myself and I
can use them in whatever recipe I desire.

Just going to let these toast for a couple
of minutes, it doesn't take very long, when

they start to become lightly golden, you know
you're done.
So keep an eye on them.

In that same skillet, I'm going to add a little
vegetable oil, you could use peanut oil, any

flavorless oil will do, and I want to get
that really nice and hot over high heat, this

is only going to cook for about five minutes
at most, use a wok, I don't have one but you

could certainly use one, I want this to get
really, really nice and hot, I'm just going

to test it with a piece of asparagus, yeah
- add my asparagus, and I'm going to just
cook these for about two minutes.
These look fantastic!

It's been two minutes, I'm going to now add
my garlic, and I'm just going to cook this

for like 30 seconds, constantly stirring because
I don't want the garlic to burn, but I also

don't want to overcook my asparagus, which
is why I'm cooking everything on high heat,

and for not that long, I just want to give
that garlic 30 seconds so that the raw flavor
can completely cook out.

Now I'm going to turn that down because this
is good, I'm going to just season with a little
bit of soy.
Ohhhh!

So good!

Make sure, make sure you use a low sodium

toasted sesame oil, this makes a really big
difference, but trust me when I tell you,

you don't need very much of it because it's
incredibly strong.
Okay, turning this off.

Add those right into your bowl.
